lexUnit.name: snout.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the projecting nose and mouth of an animal, esp. a mammal

sentence.text: Young may be carried on the snout of the mother if they are in distress ( or stillborn ) , a behaviour that is also sometimes extended to humans in distress .
One ketos disgorging Jonah has a dolphin 's tail and the head and snout of a boar and with feline feet and presumably claws .
She rose from her seat and swiped the dog a hefty blow across its snout .
In this area he builds first a small depression by removing mouthfuls of sand and then produces a nest from weeds which are coated with a sticky substance so that they can be moulded with his snout .
This pet turtle will continue walking into the glass until its snout is bloody .
Adult males sometimes have a strange excrescence on the tip of their snouts .
At her touch it raised its tiny snout again , quested here and there , and then found hers .
All use their elongated snout as a taste organ .
He had overcome the islanders ' deep dislike of the sea by night , when shadows welled in the phosphorescence and the pale monster Manjiku reared his snout from the waves .
This stimulates the male to lead her to his nest and show her the entrance by pointing his snout into it .
The purse seine nets are made of large mesh in which it is easy for a dolphin to get its flipper or snout caught .
Notice the narrow snout extending beyond the mouth which helps it to seek out small rodents , reptiles and invertebrates .
Many of the larger species are fruit eating and , because of their bright eyes and pointed snouts , are often misleadingly referred to as ` flying foxes " .

The body is long and slender , with a pointed head and it has a long pointed snout that forms a ` bill " .
The first probably had long snouts and are thought to have been the ancestors of the lemurs , now only found in Madagascar , and of the lorises that today live in the forests of the Far East .
He seemed a sinister character with his long snout and bony body , alert , watchful , suspicious .
The spiny anteater , too , has a long pointed snout , but its spines give it a superficial resemblance to a hedgehog rather than to another typical anteater .
Like the Australian marsupial Myrmecobius , it has a long and pointed snout , extremely long and pointed in this case , and an extremely long sticky tongue .
